description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Fair Finance Asia programmet syftar till att minska negativa effekter av investeringar i Asien vad gäller mänskliga rättigheter, miljö och klimat samt öka investeringar som gynnar fattigdomsminskning och inkluderande ekonomisk utveckling.
Projektets mål är en hållbar finanssektor i Asien, med finanssektorsinstitutioner verksamma på nationell och regional nivå som är mer transparenta och tar ansvar för samt respekterar mänskliga rättigheter och miljö, social, och styrnings kriterier (på engelska: Human Rights (HR) and Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) criteria).

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The Fair Finance Asia programme focuses on reducing the negative impact of investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and increasing investments in pro-poor inclusive economic development. The cross-border nature of the problem requires an approach targeting both national and regional level.
The programme's intended outcome is a sustainable finance sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering to Human Rights (HR) and Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) criteria.

The expected impact of the Fair Finance Asia programme is a reduction of the negative impact of national and cross-border bank investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and increase of adequate financial services for pro-poor inclusive economic development.
The overall objective is a sustainable finance sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering to Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) criteria.
Long term outcomes:
1) Improved regulations on integration of ESG and Human Rights criteria in the financial sector by national governments and other financial sector regulators are in place, along with improved policies and practices by national banks.
2) Regional multi-stakeholder dialogue, including Civil Society Organisations and allies, is started and results in a joint mulit-stakeholder roadmap, and conditions for a multi-stakeholder initiative are in place.
Short term outcomes:
1) Increased awareness and will among national governments, regulators, banks and banking associations to adhere to ESG standards.
2) Champions among national governments and banks are interacting with regional bodies and mutually influencing each other.
3) Regional bodies, development banks and investors are increasingly sensitive to policy asks of CSO alliances on integration of HR and ESG criteria in loan and investment policies of financial sector institutions.

description.narrative:
Despite the challenges caused by the pandemic, many good results have been achieved. For example;
- Two flagship studies have been launched and received significant coverage and interest at regional level; Asian Web; Tracking Regional Financial Flows, and Asia's Dystopian Future; Why banks need to put sustainable finance clearly in their sights.
- 54 research studies were published covering areas such as climate change, labor rights and financial access as well as providing policy recommendations for financial institutions and briefs targeting financial regulators.
- The number of partner CSOs increased with 15 during 2020 reaching a total of 79 within the FFA network.
- 22 capacity building initiatives were delivered with a total of 840 participants from financial insitutions, regulators and CSOs.
- A mid-term review was finalized providing a review of the programme including recommendations for improvement.
- All seven banks and eight insurance companies that Fair Finance Japan conducts policy assessments on have established politices to limit coal financing.
- Two banks in Indonesia that FFA works with have excluded coal-fired projects from their financing portfolio in the future.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
